techmeme.title: The UK CMA accepts Meta's changes to its ad rules to ensure Marketplace advertisers' data is not used to improve Marketplace, without having to opt in or out (Radhika Anilkumar/Reuters)
The AGs of 10 states join the DOJ's antitrust lawsuit seeking to break up Live Nation and Ticketmaster; 39 states, plus DC, are now part of the lawsuit (Daniel Tencer/Music Business Worldwide)
PitchBook: seven banks' ~$13B loans to Elon Musk to buy X have been "hung" for two years, weighing on balance sheets, the worst buyout for banks since 2008-09 (Wall Street Journal)
Black Myth: Wukong, a Chinese-made, Tencent-backed game, became Steam's most popular title ever within hours of its launch, hitting 1.8M+ concurrent players (Bloomberg)
Updated antitrust complaint: the DOJ says Ticketmaster's push for nontransferable SafeTix tickets, rolled out in 2019, aimed to make using rival services harder (Gaby Del Valle/The Verge)
